cluster_relations.rel_desc: Effective body language helps people build stronger relationships.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject behavior or communication pattern makes it easier to achieve or enhances the likelihood/quality of the interpersonal state or social outcome described by the object.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: By becoming more attuned to the signals

cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: The subject facilitates the formation or strengthening of the object, typically a social bond or interpersonal connection, without being the sole or strictly deterministic cause.

qualifiers.CausalHint: From conveying emotions and intentions to establishing rapport

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Body language supports building interpersonal connections.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: The subject facilitates the formation or strengthening of the object, typically a social bond or interpersonal connection, without being the sole or strictly deterministic cause.

qualifiers.CausalHint: to establishing rapport and building connections

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject behavior or communication pattern makes it easier to achieve, form, or strengthen the interpersonal state, bond, or social outcome described by the object, without being the sole or strictly deterministic cause.
args.justification: All three relations describe body language enabling or supporting the emergence or strengthening of positive interpersonal states (rapport, connections, stronger relationships). They share the same facilitative causal semantics and differ only in the specific social outcome. Normalizing to a single canonical predicate 'facilitates' and a unified relation class 'social_outcome_enablement_relation' improves schema consistency while preserving the CAUSALITY group.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject behavior or communication pattern makes it easier to achieve, form, or strengthen the interpersonal state, bond, or social outcome described by the object, without being the sole or strictly deterministic cause.
executed_decisions.justification: All three relations describe body language enabling or supporting the emergence or strengthening of positive interpersonal states (rapport, connections, stronger relationships). They share the same facilitative causal semantics and differ only in the specific social outcome. Normalizing to a single canonical predicate 'facilitates' and a unified relation class 'social_outcome_enablement_relation' improves schema consistency while preserving the CAUSALITY group.
